abstract.text: Creates a property that can save and restore an Optional integer,
transforming it to an Optional
data type.

inlineContent.text: The key to read and write the value to in the user defaults
The user defaults store to read and write to. A value
will use the user default store from the environment.
Defaults to nil if there is no restored value
A common usage is with enumerations:

SwiftUI-PageImage-card.png.alt: A black Swift logo on a swirly blue and purple background.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
A property wrapper type that reflects a value from
and
invalidates a view on a change in value in that user default.
Creates a property that can read and write an Optional integer user
default.
Creates a property that can read and write an Optional string user
default.
Creates a property that can read and write an Optional double user
default.
Creates a property that can save and restore an Optional integer,
transforming it to an Optional
data type.
Creates a property that can save and restore an Optional string,
transforming it to an Optional
data type.
Creates a property that can read and write an Optional data user
default.
Creates a property that can read and write an Optional boolean user
default.

default via

default.
Creates a property that can read and write an Optional URL user
default.
An interface to the users defaults database, where you store key-value pairs persistently across launches of your app.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A byte buffer in memory.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
A type that describes the aggregate identity of a SwiftData model.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
The raw type that can be used to represent all values of the conforming type.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A double-precision, floating-point value type.
A signed integer value type.
